edu.first.robot

Interface RobotMode

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    IterativeRobot, IterativeRobotAdapter, SafeRobotMode, SimpleRobot, SimpleRobotAdapter

    public interface RobotMode
    The framework for all "modes" a robot can perform, this is the basic class that tells the robot what it should do and when it should do it. RobotMode can be used in the same way as edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.IterativeRobot, making the robot only capable of acting in one way, or it can be used as a function of the robot. RobotMode is a robust way to make it possible to extend and test with different kinds of code structures and techniques without having to settle on one until it works. Good examples of robot modes are:
    • Testing
    • Competition Mode
    • FeatureXYZ Test
    • Single Driver Mode
    • Simple Drive Mode
    • Pre-Programmed Autonomous
    • Script Autonomous
    Bad examples of robot modes are:
    • Tank drive
    • Different Ports
    • Different autonomous
    Notice that a good robot mode gives the user control over some functionality that is a fundamental change in how it works. Bad robot modes change small things that could, and should be changed by things that are not robot modes. Even though the RobotMode pattern could let you do things like that relatively easily, generally there are much better ways to do so.
    Since:
    May 07 13
    See Also:
    IterativeRobot, SimpleRobot

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

    • Method Detail

      • init

        void init()
        Initializes the robot. This means that after this method is run, everything inside of it has the potential to perform actions. Run in GamePeriods.robotInit().

      • initAutonomous

        void initAutonomous()
        Initializes autonomous mode. This method should ensure that autonomous mode is ready to run, or is already running. Run in GamePeriods.autonomousInit().

      • initTeleoperated

        void initTeleoperated()
        Initializes teleoperated mode. This method should ensure that teleoperated mode is ready too run, or is already running. Run in GamePeriods.teleopInit().

      • initDisabled

        void initDisabled()
        Initializes disabled mode. This method should ensure that disabled mode is ready too run, or is already running. Run in GamePeriods.disabledInit().

      • initTest

        void initTest()
        Initializes test mode. This method should ensure that test mode is ready too run, or is already running. Run in GamePeriods.testInit().

      • periodicAutonomous

        void periodicAutonomous()
        Runs periodically during the autonomous period. The standard for periodic is 50Hz, or 20ms. This standard is not guaranteed.

      • periodicTeleoperated

        void periodicTeleoperated()
        Runs periodically during the teleoperated period. The standard for periodic is 50Hz, or 20ms. This standard is not guaranteed.

      • periodicDisabled

        void periodicDisabled()
        Runs periodically during the disabled period. The standard for periodic is 50Hz, or 20ms. This standard is not guaranteed.

      • periodicTest

        void periodicTest()
        Runs periodically during the test period. The standard for periodic is 50Hz, or 20ms. This standard is not guaranteed.

      • endAutonomous

        void endAutonomous()
        Run once after autonomous mode is done running.

      • endTeleoperated

        void endTeleoperated()
        Run once after teleoperated mode is done running.

      • endDisabled

        void endDisabled()
        Run once after disabled mode is done running.

      • endTest

        void endTest()
        Run once after test mode is done running.

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of the RobotMode to show the user when necessary.
        Returns:
        user recognizable name
